meanings.definition: Exclude or prohibit someone from doing something
meanings.sent1: The teacher debarred the student from using their phone during the exam.
meanings.sent2: The security guard debarred the unauthorized person from entering the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was debarred from stealing any more nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The locked gate debarred the curious cat from exploring the backyard.
meanings.sent5: The strict rule debarred any cheating during the game, ensuring fair play.

meanings.definition: Prevent or forbid someone from entering a place or participating in an activity
meanings.sent1: The bouncer debarred the underage individuals from entering the club.
meanings.sent2: The storm debarred the hikers from reaching the mountain peak.
meanings.sent3: The broken bridge debarred the travelers from crossing the river.
meanings.sent4: The closed sign debarred customers from entering the store after hours.
meanings.sent5: The strict dress code debarred anyone wearing sneakers from attending the event.
